title: Proposed changes
body:
- Move length and quality trimming in bonus exercises in QC practical to gain a bit of time (day 1 morning)
- Move ChIP-seq lecture in the morning of day 1
- This will give more time to go explain a bit more the codes when going through the solution of the ChIP-seq practical
- Replace SeqPlots by DeepTools in ATAC-seq practical
- Use data from the same species throughout the practical to be able to show TF, chromatin and ATAC-seq together in IGV at the end of day 2

title: Possible changes to material
body:
In QC practical:
- Change path to folder from cd ~/Desktop/QC to cd ~/Course_Materials/Practicals/QC
- Change typo (Prepare the environmnet)

title: Rewrite DiffBind exercise
body:
The current DiffBind exercise only uses 2 replicates, not a good example. We should find a different data set with at least 3 reps. One possibility would be the data from this paper:

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/27980063
MCF10A dataset - https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?acc=GSE72931
MCF7 datasets â€“ Use BRD4 E2 samples https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?acc=GSE55921

There are some nice clear heatmap plots of differentially bound regions in the two cells lines and a third ER+ cell line that we could reproduce as a final outcome of the analysis.

title: Diffbind- tidyverse packages library should be opened
body: library(tidyverse) should be included in Diffbind Practical as it is Day 2 tutorial.

title: Slides on ChIP-seq intro about CHANCE software is confusing
body: We can replace the slides from CHANCE analysis with Deeptools bamfingerprint tutorial images. H3K27me3 is usually little close to input (broader domains) and we need a properly worked IP sample to differentiate the one already in deeptools tutorial.

title: MACS2 genome size parameter space/enter should be removed
body:
macs2 callpeak -t Oct4.bam  -c Input.bam --format BAM --name Oct4 \
    --gsize 138000000 --pvalue 1e-3 --call-summits
Remove the enter/space before gsize. It ran as two commands in some computers.

title: DiffBind - MACS2 ran slowly
body: MACS2 ran slowly. Can we have the peak files already done rather than asking the trainees to do this? Anyway, the trainees learnt MACS2 at Day 1.

title: ATAC-seq: replace seqplot by deeptools
body:
There are plenty of bugs with seqplot
Since students used deeptools the day before, it would be easier to use deeptools to look at the ATAC-seq and H3K27ac signal around identified nucleosome binding sites

title: Include solutions
body: Include plots generated in the practicals (in a hidden folder we make visible at the end)

title: Discussion on normalisation methods for differential analysis
body: [ATAC-seq normalization method can significantly affect differential accessibility analysis and interpretation](https://doi.org/10.1186/s13072-020-00342-y)

title: Datasets
body:
This paper looks really nice: https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkad1225

Has ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq, RNA-seq, enough replicates, two groups (for differential binding). 

SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/?term=GSE196942
